On-screen text & graphics_on_screen_text: With a Husky, baths are rare in something gross or we're heading out on a big trip. The reason for this bath? over 20 hours to Orlando, Florida, for the Global Pet Expo - one of the biggest pet industry trade shows in the world. As a full-time content creator, & Jasper has to look his best while we network with brands from all over the world. The hardest part of any trip & I do a pretty good job for myself - but for the dogs? That's a different story. Camera gear, business cards with a QR code to my Instagram, food, treats, dental care, collars, a leash, a bandana, coat spray, ear wipes, nail care - it's all packed. With Jasper freshly bathed & my bags all packed, we're ready to hit the road! 20+ hours of driving is quite the trek. Luckily, I had a friend to split the drive with. After 17 hours, for the night before finishing our last four-hour stretch to Orlando. we're on our way to the beach! No trip to Florida is complete without a beach day. The weather was overcast, the dogs were in their element, splashing in the waves. With Global Pet Expo around the corner, a quick spritz of Gloss & Glide keeps Jasper's coat fresh & tangle-free after a salty beach day. It's the perfect travel essential for keeping him looking fresh and clean after a day at the beach.

On-screen text & graphics_on_screen_text: come bathe my dog with me while I expose him grossest camping crime ever. last summer I took both my dogs on a month long road trip. I knew that traveling with a seven month old puppy might be a little chaotic, but nothing could have prepared me after 50 hours of driving, we make it to the West Coast. The dogs are running free on the beach, living their best life. important to note this was Dune's first time ever in saltwater. Even though I hold a literal jug of freshwater he decided the ocean tasted better. fast forward to night time, I'm sharing my rooftop tent with the dogs. I give them some water before bed, probably too much... made them extra thirsty. cut to 5 a.m - I wake up to what can only be described as a crime scene. Dune has peed on everything. my pillows, my sleeping bag, my new rooftop tent mattress, everything. so I drove to the next town over at 5 a.m. to find a laundromat because I needed to wash everything. not exactly the cozy camping vibes I had in mind... but honestly, looking back it was just one rough moment in an otherwise amazing trip dogs are messy. they roll in sand, get muddy, & in Dune's case... pee in your tent. but not even this disaster would make me wish I had left them behind. thankfully, bath days Veterinary Formula make it all worth it.
